New Records: Pakistan chased down a target of 345, with Rizwan scoring an undefeated 131 and Shafique making 113.
Pakistan extended its Cricket World Cup record against Sri Lanka to 8-0.
Key Match Events: Mendis hit the fastest century for Sri Lanka in a World Cup match with 122 off 77 balls.
Samarawickrama hit an 89-ball 108, his maiden ODI century.
Mendis and Samarawickrama formed a 111-run third-wicket stand off 69 balls.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan had a sluggish start with Dilshan Madushanka taking key wickets in the powerplay.
Pakistan's victory was expected given their strong performance in the World Cup.
Post-Match Reflections: Rizwan expressed pride in the team's resilience after the win.
Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka highlighted the performances of Mendis and Samarawickrama.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a perfect batting pitch with bowlers getting walloped from both sides.
Pakistan's win was a significant morale booster ahead of their upcoming match against India.
Others: Sri Lanka had earlier lost their opening game against South Africa, scoring only 227 runs in 48.2 overs.
England also won their match against Bangladesh by 137 runs.
